DF effect) DFd:	Degrees Freedom denominator (.e., DF error) p:	p-value. p.adj: Adjusted p-values. p.signif: P-value significance. p.adj.signif: Adjusted p-value significance. p.format: Formated p-value. p.format.signif: Formated p-value significance symbols. p.adj.format: Formated adjusted p-value. n: number samples.

title: Add Welch One-Way ANOVA Test P-values to a GGPlot — stat_welch_anova_test
code: # Data preparation #%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% # Transform `dose` into factor variable df <- ToothGrowth df$dose <- as.factor(df$dose) # Add a random grouping variable set.seed(123) df$group <- sample(factor(rep(c("grp1", "grp2", "grp3"), 20))) df$len <- ifelse(df$group == "grp2", df$len+2, df$len) df$len <- ifelse(df$group == "grp3", df$len+7, df$len) head(df, 3) #>    len supp dose group #> 1  4.2   VC  0.5  grp1 #> 2 18.5   VC  0.5  grp3 #> 3 14.3   VC  0.5  grp3   # Basic boxplot #%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% # Create a basic boxplot # Add 5% and 10% space to the plot bottom and the top, respectively bxp <- ggboxplot(df, x = "dose", y = "len") +   scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.05, 0.1)))  # Add the p-value to the boxplot bxp + stat_welch_anova_test()   # Change the label position # Using coordinates in data units bxp + stat_welch_anova_test(label.x = "1", label.y = 10, hjust = 0)   # Format the p-value differently custom_p_format <- function(p) {   rstatix::p_format(p, accuracy = 0.0001, digits = 3, leading.zero = FALSE) } bxp + stat_welch_anova_test(   label = "Welch Anova, italic(p) = {custom_p_format(p)}{p.signif}" ) #> Warning: Computation failed in `stat_compare_multiple_means()`. #> Caused by error in `mutate()`: #> ℹ In argument: `label = glue(label)`. #> Caused by error: #> ! Failed to evaluate glue component {custom_p_format(p)} #> Caused by error in `custom_p_format()`: #> ! could not find function "custom_p_format"   # Show a detailed label in italic bxp + stat_welch_anova_test(label = "as_detailed_italic")    # Faceted plots #%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% # Create a ggplot facet bxp <- ggboxplot(df, x = "dose", y = "len", facet.by = "supp") +  scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.05, 0.1))) # Add p-values bxp + stat_welch_anova_test()    # Grouped plots #%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% bxp2 <- ggboxplot(df, x = "group", y = "len", color = "dose", palette = "npg")  # For each x-position, computes tests between legend groups bxp2 + stat_welch_anova_test(aes(group = dose), label = "p = {p.format}{p.signif}")   #  For each legend group, computes tests between x variable groups bxp2 + stat_welch_anova_test(aes(group = dose, color = dose), group.by = "legend.var")

title: Create a Text Graphical object — text_grob
text: label character expression vector.      objects coerced .graphicsAnnot. just justification text     relative (x, y) location.  two values, first     value specifies horizontal justification second value specifies     vertical justification.  Possible string values : "left",     "right", "centre", "center", "bottom",     "top".  numeric values, 0 means left (bottom) alignment     1 means right (top) alignment. hjust numeric vector specifying horizontal justification.     specified, overrides just setting. vjust numeric vector specifying vertical justification.     specified, overrides just setting. rot angle rotate text. color text font color. face font face. Allowed values include one "plain", "bold", "italic", "bold.italic". size font size (e.g.: size = 12) lineheight line height (e.g.: lineheight = 2). family font family. ... arguments passed textGrob.

code: text <- paste("iris data set gives the measurements in cm",              "of the variables sepal length and width",              "and petal length and width, respectively,",              "for 50 flowers from each of 3 species of iris.",              "The species are Iris setosa, versicolor, and virginica.", sep = "\n")  # Create a text grob tgrob <- text_grob(text, face = "italic", color = "steelblue") # Draw the text as_ggplot(tgrob)

title: Publication ready theme — theme_pubr
text: theme_pubr(): Create publication ready  theme theme_pubclean(): clean theme without axis lines,  direct attention data. labs_pubr(): Format  plot labels publication ready style theme_classic2():  Create classic theme axis lines. clean_theme(): Remove  axis lines, ticks, texts titles. clean_table_theme():  Clean theme table, created  ggsummarytable() .

title: Publication ready theme — theme_pubr
code: theme_pubr(   base_size = 12,   base_family = "",   border = FALSE,   margin = TRUE,   legend = c("top", "bottom", "left", "right", "none"),   x.text.angle = 0 )  theme_pubclean(base_size = 12, base_family = "", flip = FALSE)  labs_pubr(base_size = 14, base_family = "")  theme_classic2(base_size = 12, base_family = "")  clean_theme()  clean_table_theme()

title: Publication ready theme — theme_pubr
text: base_size base font size base_family base font family border logical value. Default FALSE. TRUE, add panel border. margin logical value. Default TRUE. FALSE, reduce plot margin. legend character specifying legend position. Allowed values one c("top", "bottom", "left", "right", "none"). Default "top" side position. remove legend use legend = "none". Legend position can also specified using numeric vector c(x, y).  case possible position legend inside plotting area. x y coordinates legend box. values 0 1. c(0,0) corresponds "bottom left" c(1,1) corresponds "top right" position. instance use legend = c(0.8, 0.2). x.text.angle Rotation angle x axis tick labels. Default value 0. Use 90 vertical text. flip logical. TRUE, grid lines added y axis instead x axis.

title: Publication ready theme — theme_pubr
code: p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +    geom_point(aes(color = gear))  # Default plot p   # Use theme_pubr() p + theme_pubr()   # Format labels p + labs_pubr()

title: ggpubrplus 0.9.0
text: Require ggplot2 >= 4.0.0 (breaking change). ggviolin(): add ggplot2 4.x quantile parameters; map deprecated draw_quantiles quantiles verbose migration warnings.

title: ggpubrplus 0.9.0
text: Add ggviolin deprecation-path tests quantile parameters.

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.4.1
text: Replace deprecated tidyselect helper any_of() p-value columns. Tests: adjust geom_exec() expectations ggplot2 4.0 layer parameter storage. Bump minimum versions ggrepel, tidyr, dplyr, cowplot, rlang, rstatix.

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.4
text: Convert size linewidth geom_bar()/geom_col() geom_exec() preserve bar outline widths ggplot2 4.0.0+. Tests: replace deprecated aes_() usage tidy-eval equivalents.

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.3
text: .parse_font() decimal font size parsing (ggpubr#659): Fixed bug decimal font sizes (e.g., lab.font = c(2.4, "italic", "black")) recognized, causing decimal value interpreted color index instead. regex pattern now correctly matches integer decimal (dot comma) font sizes. affects functions using lab.font parameters including ggpie(), ggdonutchart(), font parameters ggpar().

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.2
text: Refresh documentation 0.8.2 release. Clarify public create_p_label() usage tidy formatting.

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.1
text: Route p.format.signif add_stat_label() plotmath-safe asterisks. Use adjusted p-values raw p-values missing p.format.signif. Add p.decimal.mark support across p-value formatting helpers. Documentation cleanup: clarify create_p_label() public status normalize roxygen spacing.

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.0
text: Added comprehensive p-value formatting system predefined style presets match different journal publication style requirements. New Functions: - format_p_value() - Format p-values customizable decimal places, leading zero, threshold notation - get_p_format_style() - Retrieve predefined formatting style name - list_p_format_styles() - List available predefined styles New Parameters Statistical Functions: following functions now support p-value formatting parameters (p.format.style, p.digits, p.leading.zero, p.min.threshold): - stat_compare_means() - compare_means() - geom_pwc() / stat_pwc() - stat_anova_test() - stat_kruskal_test() - stat_friedman_test() - stat_welch_anova_test() - stat_cor() - ggadjust_pvalue() Available Styles: Example Usage:
code: # Use APA style formatting bxp + stat_compare_means(p.format.style = "apa")  # Use NEJM style bxp + geom_pwc(method = "t_test", p.format.style = "nejm")  # Custom formatting: 4 digits, no leading zero compare_means(len ~ dose, ToothGrowth, p.digits = 4, p.leading.zero = FALSE)  # List all available styles list_p_format_styles()

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.0
text: package modernized fork ggpubr renamed ggpubrplus avoid conflicts upstream pull request (kassambara/ggpubr#657) pending. PR merged original ggpubr updated CRAN, users can switch back original package.

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.0
text: version addresses following 10 issues original ggpubr repository:

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.0
text: Raised minimum R version R >= 4.1.0 (R >= 3.1.0) match ggplot2 >= 3.5.2 requirement. Raised minimum dplyr version dplyr >= 1.1.0 (dplyr >= 0.7.1) use modern reframe(), slice_head(), slice_tail(), across(), () functions. Raised minimum rlang version rlang >= 1.0.0 (rlang >= 0.4.6) align dplyr/tidyr requirements.

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.0
text: ggsummarytable() mutate_if() deprecation: Replaced deprecated dplyr::mutate_if() dplyr::mutate(across((...))) syntax. compare_means() () deprecation: Replaced deprecated dplyr::() modern dplyr::reframe() p-value adjustment calculations. desc_statby() () deprecation: Replaced deprecated dplyr::() dplyr::reframe() computing summary statistics groups. .top_up() .top_down() () deprecation: Replaced deprecated dplyr::(utils::tail()) dplyr::(utils::head()) modern dplyr::slice_tail() dplyr::slice_head() functions. Added explicit .groups = "drop" summarise() calls prevent grouping warnings.

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.0
text: border() size deprecation (Issues #644, #654, #656): Fixed deprecation warning border() function replacing deprecated size parameter linewidth element_rect() required ggplot2 3.4.0+. stat_cor() deprecated ..var.. notation: Updated default_aes use modern after_stat() syntax instead deprecated ..hjust.. ..vjust.. notation. stat_compare_means() deprecated ..var.. notation: Updated default_aes use after_stat(hjust) after_stat(vjust) instead deprecated ..hjust.. ..vjust.. notation. stat_regline_equation() deprecated ..var.. notation: Updated default_aes use after_stat(eq.label), after_stat(hjust), after_stat(vjust) instead deprecated notation. ggscatter() geom_rug size deprecation: Fixed deprecation warning ggscatter() rug = TRUE using linewidth instead size geom_rug(). ggpaired() geom_line size deprecation: Fixed deprecation warning ggpaired() using linewidth instead size connecting lines. ggecdf() stat_ecdf size deprecation: Fixed deprecation warning ggecdf() using linewidth instead size ECDF line. ggdensity() geom_density size deprecation: Fixed deprecation warning ggdensity() using linewidth instead size density lines. ggballoonplot() guides() FALSE deprecation: Updated use guides(size = "none") instead deprecated guides(size = FALSE).

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.0
text: ggballoonplot() tidyr::gather() deprecation: Replaced deprecated tidyr::gather() tidyr::pivot_longer(). compare_means() tidyr::gather() deprecation: Replaced deprecated tidyr::gather() tidyr::pivot_longer().

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.0
text: stat_cor() OutDec locale issue (Issue #512): Fixed parsing error options(OutDec = ",") set explicitly using decimal.mark = ".".

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.0
text: ggviolin() missing adjust parameter (Issue #552): Added adjust parameter. ggdensity() missing bw parameter (Issue #490): Added bw adjust parameters allowed options.

title: ggpubrplus 0.8.0
text: compare_means() error ref.group anova (Issue #572): Fixed error using compare_means() ref.group method = "anova".
